name: Comfort Hotel Boersparken

reviews.title: Some good......some bad.
reviews.text: First the good;

In a ludicrously expensive city the price is good - be aware that you are almost certainly going to get less than you think you are paying for, but that's just Oslo. Rooms are basic but clean, breakfast is OK (and worth quite a bit!). Loaction is handy for rail & coach station and it takes about 10 mins to walk into town.
reviews.title: not a 4 star hotel. horrible hotel

reviews.text: Now the bad;
reviews.title: Above adequate for price

likes.disliked: — Lots of drunks and drugs users in locality

reviews.text: Regular on street drug taking 50 yards down the street.
reviews.title: Wonderful service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Red light area to walk through to get into the city centre.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A short walk from train station and close to public transport options. Also a nice walk to Aker Brygge where a few restaurants are.
reviews.title: Great central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is good value. The room we stayed in was relatively big and even had a little office area. The hotel offered free internet - just ask at the reception. The bathroom was huge, however there was no shower curtain, so the bathroom floor can get a bit wet.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved the auto heating bathroom floors.. perfect for a cold morning.
reviews.title: Comfortable, Clean, Great Breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is a bit of a mad house. Very small dining room and Sunday morning was very busy and filled with hotel guests shuffling around the small buffet serving area. Breakfast items were quite nice - a mixture of cold and hot foods. Good selection of drinks.
reviews.title: Comfortable beds, modern hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is what we expected from other reports on Trip Advisor. It is near the railway station and the opera house and an easy walk into the city. Free Internet in the lobby. Free coffee in the lobby too. We didn't go out at night because we had jet lag but we would feelmoderately safe except round the back of the station.
reviews.title: Excellent choice!

likes.disliked: — No access to private mail accounts (e.g. yahoo mail, facebook) from PCs in reception area

reviews.text: This is one of those reviews I have difficulties giving a sole heading.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well, the hotel itself is OK - modern, close to Oslo Central Station (well, again, whether you like it or not is another story. I chose it because we only stayed for one night on first arrival and have an early flight to catch the next day, otherwise staying in that part of the city may not be a very good idea afterall), free tea and coffee all day, clean.
reviews.title: Bare bones, but good location

reviews.text: Service...difficult...the reception was friendly, efficient and arranged an early check-in for us. My perhaps only reservation is that I think the lady could have done better by telling me on checking-in that the next day (Mar 29, 2009) Norway would change to summer time so that we would not have missed our flight. Our Asian outlook and passport could have made it clear enough to her that we are foreigners and change of season timing is not a very handy idea to us who come from the other side of the planet.
reviews.title: A hotel that is nice to its customers

reviews.text: I noted from the reception desk that breakfast on Sunday only starts at 8am, so I deliberately asked the lady if they could arrange a takeaway sandwich as I have an early domestic flight to catch at 9am. She politely answered yes and even told me that 7:30am would be a good time to check-out. So she knew timing was important to us. It's just that it did not occur to her that some hotel guests could be so ignorant of the time change. I would expect more sensitivity from the reception desk of a reasonably decent hotel.
reviews.title: Pretty Good Location but Costly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other than that, to be honest, this hotel is fine. But on our return to Oslo from Tromso, we chose to stay in Clarion Hotel Bastion instead.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay at the Comfort Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel to attend a meeting. The room was very acceptable with good sound isolation. As a significant amenity the wireless internet has to be referred, broadband and free of charge through 8 hour telenor scratch cards given at the concierge.
reviews.title: Just the minimum

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast room is very poor in equipment as it just has the minimum that is needed to eat a meal. No trays, no saucers, plastic spoons, very simple furniture, a room that reminds a homeless dining room.
reviews.title: Worthwhile for a short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent the night here after a train ride from Bergen and before another to Stockholm. It is, yes, 2 blocks from the Oslo Sentral station, but because of one-way streets, the cab ride is longer; you're not being done in because you're a stranger. We did see some frendly-looking women on the street, but that was the extent of it at night, and in the daytime, things seem completely above board. I fell in the street and a couple of folks stopped to help, in fact.
reviews.title: Not that great

likes.disliked: — room cleanliness and front desk service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room DID have air-conditioning, to our delight, in the midst of a Norwegian heat wave. Small, yes, but no worse than New York or London, and probably better. Wonderful bed, great sheets, and quiet. Good shower, no tub in our bath. Not a great deal of storage space. Nice front desk, very happy to extend our checkout time a couple of hours, and helpful after my fall.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.text: Breakfast very busy and chaotic because of a strange layout. If you've not encountered the Norwegian breakfast before, understand that it's bread-based to a great extent. That means that the first thing the locals want is their bread. We commonly saw people with four or five slices on their plate before they headed for the other food. The preference is for slice-it-yourself bread, and all the places I've been offer that, as well as the presliced. (Hold the bread with the napkin it's probaby already wrapped in. Yes, the knives are sharp.) The Boersparken staff puts the bread right in the middle of the buffet table, which means traffic clusters there, and to either side, limiting access to the cheese, meat, eggs, chafing dishes, herring, fruit and such that grace the rest of the table. Result: A clot.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

description: Overlooking Bjørvika and the Opera house, this non-smoking hotel in Oslo’s Kvadraturen district is ideally located just a 5-minute walk from Oslo Central Station, where the Airport Express trains arrives. Newly renovated this hotel offers 248 modern rooms with an urban feeling, flat-screen TV and free Wi-Fi for all guests.Oslo’s main shopping street Karl Johan is located just 500 meters away. Comfort Hotel Børsparken is also within a 5-minute walk of Oslo’s bus, underground or tram network.Welcome to Comfort Hotel Børsparken – your first choice for great sleep, healthy foods and efficient workout.
